title: AI Tutors for Rural Schools in India: Pilot Plan
objective: Assess near-term feasibility of AI tutor pilots considering connectivity, teacher workload, and vernacular content needs; define a safe, measurable rollout.
key_questions: What minimum device/network specs are required for reliable sessions?
Which curricula and languages should be prioritized for a 3-month pilot?
What safeguards are needed for accuracy, safety, and data privacy?
methodology: Baseline survey of 10–15 schools: devices, bandwidth, timetable slots.
Co-design sessions with teachers; create 20 exemplar lesson flows.
Define guardrails: offline fallback, content filters, usage logging.
Pre/post learning assessment for pilot grades.
search_strategy: Search 'AI tutoring RCT', 'intelligent tutoring systems India' on Google Scholar.
Scan NCERT/DIKSHA for aligned open content in target languages.
Review device policy and child safety guidelines from MeitY/MoE.
sources_to_start: MeitY child safety and data protection advisories

risks_mitigations.mitigation: Offline-first flow; shared devices; cache lessons

deliverables: Pilot brief (≤2 pages) with cost envelope and success metrics
